resources.string:
FMD is an application that can help you find your phone when it gets lost.
It uses sms to communicate so you need to have a second device or a friend so you can track your phone. Just write a sms that contains "fmd" and the application will do what you want.
Still Beta.

 - Nulide
The communication with your lost phone will be via sms. So the application needs the Permission for this.\nThis Permission is needed.
Not everybody is allowed to contact your phone. So you need to select some contacts who can than communicate via sms with this application.\nThis permission is needed.

If you want to locate the gps coordinates from the phone, the application needs this permission. Please allow the application to locate you also in background.\nWhen this permission is not given, this functionality will not be activated.
You also can let the phone ring. When DoNotDisturb is activated, it may be possible that the phone is muted.\nIf you don\'t give this permission, functionality is not granted.
If you want to lock the phone or delete it when it got lost. This permission is needed.\nWhen this permission is not given, this functionality will not be activated.

This application is capable of turning on GPS when it\'s off. In order to achieve this, the application needs a special permission that you have to grant to it with a pc. If you don\'t grant this permission, it\'s no problem. You can still use this application, but you may not get a location.\n In order to enable this feature you need to enable Android Debbugging in the Settings. Go to Settings->About Phone and click on the Build Number several times, after that Developer Mode is enabled. Go to Developer-Settings and enable Debugging Mode. Than connect you Phone to your PC and download adb. If you did so execute following command "adb shell pm grant de.nulide.findmydevice android.permission.WRITE_SECURE_SETTINGS". After that press the button for giving permission to check if it worked.
